enWisdom: Admission [of one’s guilt] is [a means of] seeking pardon
The one who sins without knowing is free from sin
One who confesses his sins [and feels regret] is repentant
Confession is the intercessor of the wrongdoer

Wisdom: رُبَّ جُرْمٍ أَغْنَى عَنِ الِاعْتِذَارِ عَنْهُ الْإِقْرَارُ بِهِ
enWisdom: Sometimes the admission of guilt for having committed a sin dispenses with the need for seeking pardon
The interceder of a sinner is his admission [of guilt], his repentance and his apology

Wisdom: عَاصٍ يُقِرُّ بِذُنُوبِهِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ مُطِيعٍ يَفْتَخِرُ بِعَمَلِهِ
enWisdom: Do not dishearten a sinner, for how many a person who is occupied with his sin ends up being forgiven, and how many a person has embarked on a virtuous action which he corrupts at the end of his life and winds up in the fire of hell
One who admits his wrongdoing deserves forgiveness

Wisdom: مَا أَخْلَقَ مَنْ عَرَفَ رَبَّهُ أَنْ يَعْتَرِفَ بِذَنْبِهِ
enWisdom: How appropriate it is for one who knows his Lord to admit his sins
The best intercessor for a sinner is [his] admission [of guilt]

Wisdom: لَا اعْتِذَارَ أَمْحَى لِلذَّنْبِ مِنَ الْإِقْرَارِ
enWisdom: There is no apology that wipes out sins more than admission [of one’s guilt]
One who apologizes in a befitting manner deserves to be forgiven
He who seeks pardon has not sinned
